Authors: Takahito Kobayashi, Kentaro Hosaka, Yutaka Tamai
Title:
Type studies of the Lepiota species newly described in
1938-41 by Seiya Ito and Sanshi Imai from Japan
Abstract:
Seven type specimens originally described as members of
the genus Lepiota by S. Ito and S. Imai from Japan have been studied.
Six type specimens of these species are preserved in Hokkaido University
Museum (SAPA), and another specimen has been preserved in Tottori
Mycological Institute (TMI). Two new combinations, namely Leucoagaricus
subamanitiformis, comb. nov. and Leucocoprinus boninensis, comb. nov.
are proposed. The new name, Limacella subglischra given by Ito is
accepted here. I have confirmed that Lepiota atrovinosa, Lepiota
inconspicua and Lepiota ossaeiformispora certainly belong to the genus
Lepiota.
